ptdb.kernel.bl.search

Class AbstractSearcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • ptdb.kernel.bl.search.AbstractSearcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ResultHandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AttributeSearcher, CommandSearcher, GraphSearcher, HierarchyFetcher, NameSearcher

    public abstract class AbstractSearcher
extends java.lang.Object
implements ResultHandler
    The abstract parent class for all the concrete searcher classes.

    The entire search module is implemented in a pipe and filter chain. Each concrete searcher in the chain is a concrete class of this AbstractSearcher class, and they are configured to search on different set of search criteria that input by the user.

    The actual combination of searchers chain is configured in SearchManager.

    Since:
    Ptolemy II 10.0
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Alek Wang
    Accepted Rating:
    red (wenjiaow)
    Proposed Rating:
    red (wenjiaow)

        protected boolean _isIndependent
        Indicate whether the searcher existing depends on the existing of other searchers. For example, the HierarchyFetcher needs to be configured with other dependent searcher, otherwise it is useless.

    • Method Detail

      • handleIntermediateResults

        public void handleIntermediateResults(java.util.List<XMLDBModel> intermediateResults,
                                      ResultHandler resultHandler)
        Handle the intermediate results that found and passed by the other searcher.

        The searcher normally passes the intermediate results to the next result handler.

        Specified by:
        handleIntermediateResults in interface ResultHandler
        Parameters:
        intermediateResults - The intermediate results to be handled.
        resultHandler - The result handler that found and pass these results.

      • handleResults

        public void handleResults(java.util.ArrayList<XMLDBModel> modelResults)
                   throws DBConnectionException,
                          DBExecutionException
        Handle the model results passed to this class, and handle the results according to the certain search criteria. The search criteria is passed to the concrete searchers when they are constructed.
        Specified by:
        handleResults in interface ResultHandler
        Parameters:
        modelResults - The results to be handled in this searcher.
        Throws:
        DBConnectionException - Thrown by the DBConnectorFactory if getting the DBConnection from it, which indicates that the DBConnection cannot be obtained.
        DBExecutionException - Happens in the execution of DB tasks, and is thrown by the concrete searcher if they are performing the actual searching in the database.

      • isSearchCancelled

        public boolean isSearchCancelled()
        Check whether the search process has been canceled by the user.
        Specified by:
        isSearchCancelled in interface ResultHandler
        Returns:
        true - The search has been canceled by the user.
        false - The search hasn't been canceled.

      • isPassed

        public boolean isPassed()
        Check with this searcher has been passed the searching. Some of the searcher may require multiple rounds of searching in a loop, and the partial results will be passed to the next result handler during the execution loop. This method indicates whether the current searcher has finished the entire searching that it wants to do.
        Returns:
        true - if the searching has passed in this searcher.
        false - if the searching has not passed in this searcher.

      • noIntersect

        public void noIntersect()
        Mark this searcher as it does not need to intersect the results it find with the results passed by other searchers.

      • passErrorModels

        public void passErrorModels(java.util.List<XMLDBModel> errorModels)
        In the case of getting some models that cannot be parsed or contains some error, use this method to pass these error models to store for error handling.
        Specified by:
        passErrorModels in interface ResultHandler
        Parameters:
        errorModels - The error models.

      • setConnection

        public void setConnection(DBConnection connection)
        Set the DB connection for this searcher.
        Specified by:
        setConnection in interface ResultHandler
        Parameters:
        connection - The DBConnection instance to be set in this searcher.

        public void setFirstSearcher()
        Mark this searcher as the first searcher in the chain.

      • setLastSearcher

        public void setLastSearcher()
        Mark this searcher as the last searcher in the chain.

      • setNextResultHandler

        public void setNextResultHandler(ResultHandler nextResultHandler)
        Set the next result handler object to this searcher. This searcher will use the next handler to pass the results from this searcher.
        Parameters:
        nextResultHandler - The next ResultHandler to set to this handler.

      • setPreviousSeacher

        public void setPreviousSeacher(AbstractSearcher previousSearcher)
        Set the previous searcher that does the searching before this searcher.
        Parameters:
        previousSearcher - The previous searcher to set in this searcher.

      • wholeSearchDone

        public void wholeSearchDone()
                     throws DBConnectionException
        Notify the search result buffer that the searching is done. The whole search means all the system's entire search process for a given complete search criteria.
        Specified by:
        wholeSearchDone in interface ResultHandler
        Throws:
        DBConnectionException - Thrown from the database layer if the database connection cannot be obtained.

        In case of getting model result with error or cannot be parsed, use this method to add the error model to the stored error models list.
        Parameters:
        errorModel - The error model to be added to the list.

        protected boolean _isFirstSearcher()
        Check whether this searcher is the first searcher in the chain.
        Returns:
        true - this searcher is the first searcher in the chain.
        false - this searcher is not the first searcher in the chain.

        false - this searcher is not independent.

      • _isIntersectNeeded

        protected boolean _isIntersectNeeded()
        Check with this searcher needs to intersect the results that it finds with the passed results from the other searchers.
        Returns:
        true - this searcher needs to intersect the results with other searchers.
        false - this searcher does not need to intersect the results with other searchers.

      • _search

        protected abstract void _search()
                         throws DBExecutionException,
                                DBConnectionException
        Perform the actual search.
        Throws:
        DBExecutionException - Thrown from the database layer if there is error occurring during the search.
        DBConnectionException - Thrown by the DBConnectorFactory if getting the DBConnection from it, which indicates that the DBConnection cannot be obtained.
